intro: Choisya katherinae, commonly known as the Katherine's haworthia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, white flowers on thin stems during the summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
